title: Koch Industries Earns 2023 ENERGY STAR Partner of the Year Award for Energy Management - PR Newswire
summary: Koch Industries, Inc. wins the EPA's ENERGY STAR® Partner of the Year Award for 2023, maintaining its status in the Sustained Excellence category. The company has demonstrated superior energy performance and investments in energy efficiency and renewable energy projects across its facilities.
green_innovation: TRUE. The article describes how Koch Industries has earned the EPA's ENERGY STAR Partner of the Year Award, showcasing the company's commitment to energy efficiency and sustainability.
business_innovation: TRUE. The article highlights Koch Industries' adoption of energy-efficient products and sustainable strategies, indicating a business innovation in their operations.
green_product: FALSE. The article mentions energy-efficient products and sustainability strategies but does not focus on a specific green product meeting the comprehensive definition provided. Therefore, it does not align as a green product.
green_process: TRUE. Koch Industries' initiatives to reduce energy consumption, emissions, and waste across its facilities qualify as green processes, promoting sustainability.

greenwashing: FALSE. The article emphasizes Koch Industries' achievements and investments in energy efficiency and sustainability without providing false or misleading information, indicating it is not an example of greenwashing.

title: What you need to know about the Species Recovery Programme Capital Grant scheme - Natural England
summary: Natural England is launching a new capital grant scheme called the Species Recovery Programme Capital Grant Scheme to support projects focused on species recovery and habitat enhancement. The grant will run over two financial years (23/24 and 24/25) and will fund projects that benefit Priority, Threatened, or Near Threatened species, contributing to the Environment Act target to reduce the risk of extinction. The grant scheme encourages collaborative projects and includes grant requests of between £50,000 and £500,000, with payments made quarterly for eligible expenditures.
